session_info.session_focus: GraphRAG-Driven Intelligent Resource Placement & Broken Link Transformation
session_info.context: Continue broken link fixes using GraphRAG as institutional brain for semantic resource placement

discoveries.title: Activities Filtering System: Transform Broken Links into Resource Discovery
discoveries.description: Successfully transformed broken activities.html?type=warmup links into functional resource discovery system with 22 structured activities

technical_details.functionality: URL parameter filtering, dynamic content updates, semantic activity categorization

discoveries.educational_impact: Teachers can now access categorized activities through working filter links instead of 404s
discoveries.cultural_integration: Activities include Te Ao Māori perspectives with whakataukī, cultural values, and bicultural frameworks

discoveries.title: Gemini's Systematic Broken Link Cleanup
discoveries.description: Committed Gemini's comprehensive approach: simplify complex links, disable dead links with javascript:void(0)

technical_details.approach: Simplify fragment links, disable coming-soon links, streamline content_gap_analysis.json

discoveries.strategic_insight: Complementary approach to building-out: where resources exist connect them, where they don't exist disable cleanly

discoveries.title: Project ARONUI Phase 4: Agentic Integration Active
discoveries.description: Phase 4 implementation confirmed - real-time GraphRAG with MCP message broker for proactive recommendations

technical_details.architecture: Event-driven with WebSocket/SSE, MCP message broker
technical_details.workflow: User action -> Event message -> Graph update -> Proactive recommendation -> UI update

discoveries.strategic_value: Platform can now use GraphRAG as institutional brain for intelligent resource placement decisions

discoveries.title: Resource Discovery Methodology: GraphRAG-Guided Semantic Placement
discoveries.description: Framework for using GraphRAG to identify semantic relationships and guide intelligent resource placement

approach.step_1: Query GraphRAG for semantic similarities between orphaned resources and broken link destinations
approach.step_2: Build structured skeletons for missing functionality guided by GraphRAG insights
approach.step_3: Update GraphRAG with each placement decision to enhance future recommendations
approach.continuous_learning: Every resource placement feeds back into knowledge graph

example_targets: Subject pages -> content organization by GraphRAG similarity

broken_link_progress.next_targets: Cultural filtering, unit navigation, subject page content organization

graphrag_integration.recommended_usage: Query for semantic similarities before placing resources
graphrag_integration.update_frequency: Every resource placement should update knowledge graph
intelligence_applications: Identify which orphaned resources semantically match broken link destinations
Suggest content skeletons based on user behavior patterns
Recommend resource groupings by educational similarity

next_session_priorities.importance: Enable GraphRAG to guide intelligent resource placement

next_session_priorities.task: Query GraphRAG for semantic matches between orphaned content and broken links
Implement handouts.html?type=cultural filtering using GraphRAG insights
next_session_priorities.importance: Continue broken link -> resource discovery transformation

strategic_insights: GraphRAG as institutional brain enables intelligent resource placement rather than random organization
Every resource placement decision should feed back into knowledge graph for continuous learning
Build-out approach creates educational value while fixing broken links
Semantic similarity analysis can guide where orphaned resources should be surfaced
